name: Onion Salad
history: Onion Salad is a common side dish in many cuisines around the world. It's known for its simplicity and the sharp, refreshing taste of raw onions, often used to complement heavier main dishes.
description: Onion Salad is a simple, crunchy, and flavorful salad made with sliced onions, often red or white, seasoned with herbs, spices, and a dressing of lemon juice or vinegar. It's a refreshing side dish, perfect for balancing rich and spicy flavors.

instructions.title: Prepare Onions
instructions.description: Soak the thinly sliced onions in cold water for about 5 minutes to remove some of their sharpness. Drain well.

instructions.title: Mix Ingredients
instructions.description: In a mixing bowl, combine the sliced onions, lemon juice or vinegar, chopped cilantro, green chilies (if using), salt, black pepper, sugar (if using), and cumin powder (if using).

instructions.title: Serve
instructions.description: Toss everything together until well mixed. Serve the onion salad as a side dish with your main meal.

tips: Soaking the onions in cold water helps to mellow their flavor.
Adjust the amount of lemon juice or vinegar to balance the tanginess.
variations: Add sliced tomatoes or cucumbers for a more substantial salad.
Sprinkle with chaat masala for an extra burst of flavor.

storage.shelfLife: Best consumed fresh. If needed, can be refrigerated for a few hours.
storage.instructions: Cover and refrigerate if not serving immediately.

presentationTips: Serve in a small salad bowl or as part of a larger salad platter.
Garnish with additional fresh herbs or a sprinkle of spice for color.
